subject: Re: [junit] Re: Did my question get missed, somehow?
msgSnippet: ... So, perhaps the problem is that you are now past the unit/programmer level testing and are getting into the functional testing arena.  JUnit was not
messageBody:
On Friday 16 July 2004 06:32 pm, cypherfox wrote:
> Greetings,
> This is true.  I recall reading about that 'trap', and I can
> definitely agree that's where the breakdown is.  For my
> project, there are (imo) very well-defined, good reasons
> to test like this.  (A small one of which is that it was the
> perfect way to build the server structure in a 'test-first'
> manner, a much larger one is knowing the precise
> performance implications of each functional unit of the
> program.)  They have nothing to do with JUnit's mission,
> however, and everything to do with mine as a developer.

So, perhaps the problem is that you are now past the unit/programmer level
testing and are getting into the "functional" testing arena. JUnit was not
designed to work in this arena, though it does work quite well.
